e4: Changing to the new policy aligns financial reporting with ethical standards, promoting trust and transparency, essential for solid long-term relationships with investors. This approach decreases risks of regulatory repercussions and legal issues by ensuring compliance with standard accounting practices, thereby fostering a more sustainable business model.
e5: An ethical reporting policy is characterized by accuracy, transparency, and honesty, ensuring information is truthful and not misleading. It should align with legal standards, fostering trust among investors with clear and accessible communication about any policy changes. An ethical policy should efficiently accommodate and educate both sophisticated and retail investors to empower sound decision-making equally across all investor types, ultimately enhancing confidence and fairness in the marketplace.
e6: Yes, I would ask: How will you plan to effectively communicate the policy change to investors to mitigate misunderstanding or market overreaction? What steps will be taken to ensure that all investors, especially less attentive retail investors, are aware of the transition to a no-bias policy? How will market impacts be monitored and addressed?
